text: a pretty rough Ginjo, i think they lied about that .. . very boozy, great legs.. . cream, sweet rice, young rind .. . very hot in the throat .. . in the lower sake ranks .. . . has anyone else smelled todays garbage? and I thought yesterdays smelled good!
bottle, thanks to mar, clear water pour with short legs, vanilla, cardboard, grape peel flavors, coconut and cantalope rind aromas
(300ml bottle thanks to mar) clear still, mild coating of the glass. Nose of rice, peace and alcohol. Taste of mild fusels, peach, maple syrup. Smooth and sweet.
clear with ok looking legs.  nose is alcohol, rice, and faint florals.  not bad on the palate, flavor is alcohol, florals, and nuts.
(300ml bottle, courtesy of mar)  Pours a transparent body with nice legs.  Aroma of vanilla, almonds, and rice.  Flavor of almond, plum, and vanilla.
Thanks to mar for sharing this bottle. Clear with a licorice aroma. Flavor is licorice, alcohol, rice, nutty and some sweetness.

Shared with ilovedarkbeer. Clear body with tons of legs left on the glass. Plums and rice in the aroma with some alcohol. Nice and sweet taste, but a bit unbalanced. Very watery mouthfeel with alcohol.

Special, meh, Not impressed. Pours a yellow tinged color with obviosuly no head, decent leg though. Nose is dry fruity and a bit muted. Taste is a bit unbalanced and not exactly smooth. As far as sake goes, you can do much better.

Fragrant, perfumy aroma. Orange zest and violet. Pour is a tad creamy yellow. Light but delicate, very well balanced flavor. Full body and a hint of alcohol on the finish. Lots of complexity in the flavor, very slighty fruit, florals, peanut. Very very tasty.
Crystaline pour and a nose of plums and lychee.  Nice floral component.  Flavour is sweet with vanillins and lychee fruits.  Great flavour and dangerously drinkable.
poured a clear color with a strong cuccumber aroma.  Taste was sweeter then  what i am used too, as in im used to dry sake. A really smooth body, alcohol was hidden.
Poured pale yellowish and smelled of hazelnuts and almonds...taste was sweet and alcohol with a quick dry finish...

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2008 [heated carafe] Id never had any sort of sake before, so I really didnt know what to expect. When this arrived, it came in a ceramic carafe and it was steaming hot. I always thought you were supposed to drink sake room temperature, not hot. So I poured some in the ochoko and waited for it to cool. When I drank it it tasted a little too sweet and yeasty for my taste. Thats when my friend said that its better hot. So I tried it hot. Completely transparent and colorless. It had a very sweet and fermented aroma that almost smelled like raisins. Initial taste was very sweet that gave way to a smooth and sweet yeast flavor. Very warming going down and left a nice, sweet aftertaste. A very good first sake experience.

I've had better sake but have no idea what they were. I sampled this at Waldo's Campus Tavern at a beer tasting. We actually made Japanese Car Bombs, dropping a shot of this sake into a glass of Sapporo and downing it. Different, but quite nice.
